ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: making them like stripped wheat-stalks eaten bare?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And turned them into pastured fields of corn?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and made them like straw eaten up (by cattle).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to turn them into (something) like the left-over grass grazed by cattle.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So He made them like the leftover devoured leaves of farms?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And He made them like `Asf, Ma'kul.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: So He rendered them like straw eaten up?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and He made them like green blades devoured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And made them like green crops devoured (by cattle)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Thus He made them like stubble cropped by cattle?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then He rendered them as stubble devoured.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: thus making them like chewed-up straw?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then did He make them like an empty field of stalks and straw, (of which the corn) has been eaten up.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And made them like an empty field of stalks (of which the corn has been eaten up by cattle).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: so that He made them like straw eaten (by cattle).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And He made them like eaten straw.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [105:5] thus making them like devoured blades?, like the leaves of crops which have been consumed, trampled and destroyed by animals. God destroyed each one of them with his own stone, inscribed with his name, larger than a lentil [in size] but smaller than a chick-pea, able to pierce through an egg, a man, or an elephant and go through the ground. This took place in the year of the Prophet’s birth (s).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And made them like green crops devoured) by worms?' And of the surah in which Quraysh is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 17 words and 73 letters: Surah 106: Quraysh And of the surah in which Quraysh is mentioned, which is all Meccan and consists of 4 verses, 17 words and 73 letters:
